roleset.name: make a popping sound
roleset.note: POP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'pop' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from pop.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: popcorn
example.text: John's knees pop every time he stands up.

example.name: Arg0
example.text: Is knee popping a sign of a serious health problem?

roleset.name: pop, burst
roleset.note: POP-V NOTES: Another verb where the rolesets are obviously related--if you arebursting something, it is probably making a 'pop' sound. (from pop.02-v)

example.name: popcorn
example.text: John is popping popcorn in the microwave.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: His popping the balloon frightened the dog.

roleset.name: move suddenly
roleset.note: POP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'pop' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from pop.04-v predicate notes)

example.name: a couple arguments
example.text: ``I think the market could pop up to the $1.22 to $1.25 level without too much difficulty,'' he said.

example.name: not just stocks
example.text: Analysts and competitors said the move reflects a growing need by the stores to expand their customer base beyond the traditional blue-collar worker who [*T*-1] pops into a convenience store for a sandwich, cigarettes, soda or beer.
example.arg: for a sandwich, cigarettes, soda or beer

roleset.name: hit
roleset.note: POP-V NOTES: Roleset added by Claire (from pop.05-v)

role.descr: mention of punch, hit itself if present

example.name: punch in the face
example.text: The boss at this roadblock popped me one in the face.

roleset.name: pop up: appear
roleset.note: POP_UP-V NOTES: Frame edited by Arrick (from pop.03-v)

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: Dealing with the sales this month could be particularly challenging because almost every problem that has hobbled the program in the past is popping up again.
example.arg: almost every problem that has hobbled the program in the past

example.name: with agent
example.text: Stacy Brown ~MSNBC analyst author of Michael Jackson the Man Behind the Mask and a name who *T*-1 keeps popping up with all these books.

roleset.name: do drugs (might be particular to heroin?)
roleset.note: POP_OFF-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from pop.06-v)

example.name: both args
example.text: why-1 are the modern junkies popping it off in their cars and driving *-1 ???
